member.name: T:Infragistics.DataMapping
member.summary: Defines a mapping between database and internal property names.
member.remarks:
Datamappings allow specification of one-to-one and one-to-many property name mappings.
Typically, unrefererenced internal properties will not be assigned to and unreferenced external properties will be ignored. It is often valid to assign to arbitrary internal property ("custom") names, although this is not functionality implemented by the DataMapping class, which simply provides the mapping mechanism.

member.name: M:Infragistics.DataMapping.TryAdd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to safely add a new datamapping pair to the current datamapping object.
member.returns: True if the mapping pair was successfully added.
member.remarks: Datamappings cannot contain null internal or external names, or duplicate internal names.

member.name: M:Infragistics.DataMapping.TryAdd(Infragistics.DataMappingPair)
member.summary: Attempts to safely add a new datamapping pair to the current datamapping object.
member.returns: True if the mapping pair was successfully added.
member.remarks: A Datamapping should not attempt to map multiple external names to a single internal name.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.LeastSquaresFit.LinearFit(System.Int32,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double},System.Func{System.Int32,System.Double})
member.summary: Creates coefficients for the linear least squares fit y=A+Bx
member.param: Number of items in the series.
Delegate which returns the nth x value.
Delegate which returns the nth y value.
member.remarks:
If either of the x or y for a given point are NaN, the point is not taken into account for the fitting operation. Infinite values are valid, but are likely to result in numerical instability.
Weisstein, Eric W. "Least Squares Fitting." From MathWorld--A Wolfram Web Resource. http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LeastSquaresFitting.html
member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.returns: A, B as an array of doubles or null if no solution.

member.name: M:Infragistics.PolySimplification.VertexReduction(System.Tuple{System.Double[],System.Double[]},System.Double)
member.summary:
Simple vertex reduction algorithm. Complexity: O(n)
Summary: Include P0 in the result, and set R = P0. Iterate through subsequent points P1,P2,... until distance(PN, R) > tolerance. Include PN in the result, and set R = PN. Continue iterating in this fashion until there are no more points to consider for inclusion.
member.param: The minimum distance allowed between adjacent points
member.returns: List of accepted points

member.summary: Returns the square of the distance between p1 and p2.

member.name: M:Infragistics.RectUtil.GetInflated(System.Windows.Rect,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Expands or shrinks the current rectangle by using the specified width and height amounts, in all directions. The size and position of the current rectangle are not changed.
member.remarks:
The Width of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified width offset, because it is applied to both the left and right sides of the rectangle. Likewise, the Height of the resulting rectangle is increased or decreased by twice the specified height.
If the specified width or height shrink the rectangle by more than its current Width or Heightgiving the rectangle a negative areathe rectangle becomes the Empty rectangle.
member.param: The amount by which to expand or shrink the left and right sides of the rectangle.
The amount by which to expand or shrink the top and bottom sides of the rectangle.
member.returns: Inflated rectangle.

member.name: T:Infragistics.SmartPlaceableWrapper`1
member.summary: ISmartPlaceable wrapper class for a FrameworkElement. For use with the SmartPlacer class.

member.name: T:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable
member.summary: Interface for objects placed by a smart placer object.
member.remarks: Although there is a clear intent to SmartPosition values, implementing classes are free to interpret the values as they wish. The only restriction being that the position parameter be interpreted coherently: the bounds set by calling SetPosition() should be identical to those returned by calling GetPosition()

member.name: M:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartPositions
member.summary:
Gets an array of valid positions for the current object. Objects can individually place restrictions on where they can be placed, although in reality it's more likely that they'll just return a static array.
The order of the valid positions has some significance, in that although the placer will choose the best overall position, it will stop searching as soon as it finds an ideal one. The upshot of all of this is that you should return an array sorted in order of preferred placement.
member.returns: Array of valid smart positions for the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.GetSmartBounds(Infragistics.SmartPosition)
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the current object if it were placed at the specified position.
member.returns: Bounds for the current object

member.name: P:Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable.SmartPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the current object.
member.remarks: After the smart position is set, the current object's bounds are assumed to be that returned from GetSmartBounds() if called with the same position.

member.name: T:Infragistics.SmartPlacer
member.summary: Manages the position for each object in a set of managed SmartPositions in an attempt to minimise overlap.
member.remarks: Collision avoidance uses a greedy algorithm running in O(n^2) with O(n) storage. Although there are no known algorithms running in less time than this, simulated annealing may produce slightly better results with comparable execution time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new SmartPlacer with the default configuration.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Place(Infragistics.ISmartPlaceable)
member.summary:
Place the object with respect to currently placed object. Calling this method causes the object to be immediately updated, but has no effect on previously placed objects.
Placeables which cannot be placed within the placement bounds or without overlapping previously placed objects are hidden

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Bounds
member.summary: Sets or gets the placement bounds for this smart placer. Setting the placement bounds has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Overlap
member.summary: Sets or gets the maximum permissible placed overlap expressed as a percentage [0, 1] of each placeable's area. Setting the placement overlap has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SmartPlacer.Fade
member.summary: Sets or gets the fade exponent for ISmartPlaceables which exceed the current overlap. Setting the placement fade has no effect on previously placed objects.

member.name: T:Infragistics.StackPool`1
member.summary: Represents a pool of reusable objects.

member.name: M:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Pop
member.summary: Gets an object from the pool.
member.remarks: The pool will either Create a new object or Activate one which was previously returned and Disactivated. If DeferDisactivate is set there may be pending active objects available which will be reused directly).
member.returns: An object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Push(`0)
member.summary: Returns an object to the pool for recycling.
member.remarks:
All references to objects which have been returned to the pool should be destroyed.
When an object is returned to the pool it will be immediately Disactivated (unless DeferDisactivate is set) and may also be Destroyed either immediately or some time later.

member.name: F:Infragistics.StackPool`1.active
member.summary: The active object collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.StackPool`1.limbo
member.summary: The limbo object collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.StackPool`1.inactive
member.summary: The inactive object collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.DeferDisactivate
member.summary: Sets or gets the DeferDisactivate flag.
member.remarks:
When the pool is marked to defer disactivation, objects returned to the pool are not immediately disactivated, instead remaining in a limbo state where they are available for reuse without Activation. Resetting DeferDisactivate causes all of these limbo objects to be disactivated and potentially destroyed.
Deferred disactivation is useful where the activation/disactivation cycle is costle (such as add/remove a VisualElement from a ParentItem Panel).

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.ActiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of active items in the current StackPool object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.InactiveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of inactive (not including limbo) items in the current StackPool object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Create
member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to create new items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Deactivate
member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to disactivate items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Activate
member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to activate items.

member.name: P:Infragistics.StackPool`1.Destroy
member.summary: Gets or sets the function used to destroy old items.

member.name: T:Infragistics.InteractionHelper
member.summary: The InteractionHelper provides controls with support for all of the common interactions like mouse movement, mouse clicks, key presses, etc., and also incorporates proper event semantics when the control is disabled.

member.name: F:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInMilliseconds
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are temporally local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.). 500 milliseconds is the default double click value on Windows. This value would ideally be pulled form the system settings.

member.name: F:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.SequentialClickThresholdInPixelsSquared
member.summary: The threshold used to determine whether two clicks are spatially local and considered a double click (or triple, quadruple, etc.) in pixels squared. We use pixels squared so that we can compare to the distance delta without taking a square root.

member.name: F:Infragistics.InteractionHelper._updateVisualState
member.summary: Reference used to call UpdateVisualState on the base class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the InteractionHelper class.

member.name: M:Infragistics.InteractionHelper.UpdateVisualState(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
member.remarks: UpdateVisualState works differently than the rest of the injected functionality. Most of the other events are overridden by the calling class which calls Allow, does what it wants, and then calls Base. UpdateVisualState is the opposite because a number of the methods in InteractionHelper need to trigger it in the calling class. We do this using the IUpdateVisualState internal interface.

member.summary: Update the visual state of the control.
member.param: A value indicating whether to automatically generate transitions to the new state, or instantly transition to the new state.
